definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: When shocked, she opens her mouth as she knits her brows.
sentences.chinese: 当她震惊的时候，她会张开嘴巴，同时皱起眉头。

sentences.english: Is simultaneous, in the outside, final officer rain poem waited a human to likewise furrow up eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 同时的，在外面，上官雨诗等人也皱起了眉头。

sentences.english: Thomas made a little grimace, perhaps he thought the wine was sour.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯微微皱起眉头可能是他认为酒发酸了。

sentences.english: To conceal this moment with a radian already a wrinkled face sad.
sentences.chinese: 一抹弧度来掩饰此刻已皱起的一脸难过。

sentences.english: The person is always frowning in the "before" picture.
sentences.chinese: 看到减肥前的照片，人们总是皱起眉头。

sentences.english: Hermione, however, leaned against the Owlery wall, folded her arms, and frowned at Ron.
sentences.chinese: 赫敏靠在棚屋的墙上，抱着双臂，对罗恩皱起了眉头。

sentences.english: Jastrow knit his brow fiercely at his niece .
sentences.chinese: 杰斯特罗狠狠地对他侄女皱起眉头。

sentences.english: She grimaced at the sight of all the work.
sentences.chinese: 她一看到这么多的工作就皱起了眉头。

sentences.english: Natasha sat the whole time without speaking, looking up from under her brows at him.
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎始终默不作声地坐着，皱起眉头望着他。

sentences.english: His eyebrows were knitted together as usual, and his lips were pursed.
sentences.chinese: 他的眉毛像往常一样皱起，嘴唇撅着。

sentences.english: His brow again furrowed with effort.
Her forehead crinkled almost as if it hurt to speak.
sentences.chinese: 她的额头皱起好象它被要说的话刺痛。

sentences.english: Doctor Burleigh swung round in his desk-chair and frowned at the old farmer.
sentences.chinese: 伯利医生随即在他的办公桌圆椅和老农民皱起了眉头。

sentences.english: Frowning, he saw the chart now in his mind's eye but not clearly.
sentences.chinese: 他皱起眉头，仿佛在脑子里看到那张图，但模糊不清。

definition: to have heard what was said
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
